channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-19650] ABFS: NPE when close() called on uninitialized filesystem
item.description:
code

  public void testABFSConstructor() throws Throwable {
    new AzureBlobFileSystem().close();
  }

stack

[ERROR] org.apache.hadoop.validator.TestRuntimeValid.testABFSConstructor -- Time elapsed: 0.003 s <<< ERROR!
java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "org.apache.hadoop.fs.azurebfs.AzureBlobFileSystemStore.getClient()" because "this.abfsStore" is null
        at org.apache.hadoop.fs.azurebfs.AzureBlobFileSystem.close(AzureBlobFileSystem.java:800)
        at org.apache.hadoop.validator.TestRuntimeValid.testABFSConstructor(TestRuntimeValid.java:49)
item.summary: ABFS: NPE when close() called on uninitialized filesystem

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
Thanks for reporting this.
Will work on the patch on priority.

URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/7880#discussion_r2288107530

Review Comment:
@bhattmanish98 I don't see concurrency issues because close() is synchronized, and once closed it can't be closed again. Of course, once one thread has closed it, nobody else can use the instance. fix: don't do that.
